info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 31 at 10:07AM PST until December 31 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow showers expected. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. * WHERE...Elevations near and above 2500 feet in Jackson County. This includes portions of highway 66 at and near Green Springs, portions of highway 140 near Lake of the Woods, portions of Highway 62 near Prospect, and the Tiller Highway north of Trail. Interstate 5 southeast of Ashland is likely to be affected, as well as areas around Butte Falls. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Most of the snow showers are likely to occur prior to 1 PM PST. However, snow showers could linger through about 4 PM PST on I-5 in the Siskiyou Summit area as well as at Green Springs Summit. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
